reviews.text: Excellent location first of all. Subway round the corner, 2 min walk to the Eifel Tower - could you dream about it ? Sure not all furniture are brand new, in halls there are some little scratches on the walls. Light switchers in room are still a mystery to me, I haven't figured out how they work actually. Bathroom are spacious, comfy and convinient.
reviews.title: Nice offer with a remarkable view.

reviews.text: 4.5 out of 5 for a 4star hotel in my opinion.
reviews.title: Not worthy

reviews.text: Have to echo the fact that the only good thing is its right at the Tower. It was expensive - and this can only be due to location as all other aspects were sub-standard for this price. The rooms are in need of refreshing, the balcony's are unsettling, and ... the breakfast ! The staff were spending their time clearing tables - had to ask three times for two cups of tea, and when it came there were only flavoured teas (I know its a British thing, but they did bring what we'd call normal tea when asked). Nobody knew how to use the toaster, so nobody (except myself) bothered. By the way - I never accept the excuse "we're very busy") - that makes it the customers' faults for giving you their business.
reviews.title: The only good point is that you can walk to the Eiffel Tower.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is superb, with the Eiffel Tower at your doorstep and several bistros and restaurants close by. The Bir Hakim Metro is a couple of blocks away, affording easy access to the rest of Paris.
reviews.title: Fantastic location to Eiffel Tower

reviews.text: I had a room with a Murphy bed, which means it was one of their smaller offerings. That said, it was larger than many double rooms I've had in Paris and offered a sofa, refreshment bar and easy chair. The bath had an American style full length shower curtain rather than the normal 1/3 length glass door.
reviews.title: Fab location, wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: Location is great, just a few steps from the Eiffel Tower. Rooms are clean and big (for French hotel standards).
reviews.title: Great location, nice, big rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Pullman Paris Tour Eiffel on April 2 for 3 nights, we're so happy with our selection, we couldn't have chosen a better hotel..The rooms are large, very clean, the bed is super comfy, the bathroom is big and with all the amenities, you have a coffee maker in the room (which is rare in Europe) plus.. you have a balcony with the most incredible view of the Eiffel Tower!!! You can't get a closer view than this one, and at night is georgeous!! The Pullman is right in the heart of Paris, you can walk to the Eiffel Tower, to the River Cruises, to the Double Deckers Bus Tours, and there are many bistros around the hotel, open for B/L/D..a little expensive though..The neighorhood is very upscale, with beautiful buildings.
reviews.title: Best location in Paris!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Superb hotel, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location and so close to the Eiffel Tower. We were told we wouldn't have a view of the Eiffel Tower but we did and it was great!! Especially when it was lit up at night!! The staff are extremely helpful and pleasant. Room was a good size. Only problem was that we had 2 single beds pushed together ( and came apart in the night!!) and had to ask for a replacement room. However the staff were very co-operative and a change of room was arranged with the minimum of fuss. Nice bar. Expensive but this is Paris - enjoy!!
reviews.title: 3V: Value, View, Voluminous

reviews.text: I took my friend's 15 year old daughter and my 23 year old niece to France and they loved this hotel. I think it helped immediately upon arrival that Vinney from Jersey Shore was in the lobby. The rooms were roomy and comfortable and clean, the staff was so friendly and loved their breakfast buffet. We were right next to the Eiffel Tower and walked there every night for a dinner picnic. Everyone spoke English very well, the staff encouraged our 15 year old to speak French, much to her delight. We were within walking distance of Metro and worked out perfectly for us. We ate a three restaurants close by and loved the wait staff and the food, as well as utilized some simple convenience stores that were just as accommodating.
reviews.title: Had a great time! Would recommend this hotel. Hope I get to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a short romantic break. Balcony overlooked the Eiffel tower. Room ok...furniture a bit shabby, room nothing special, not a lot of character and very expensive! Bed comfy and up to a robust game of scrabble (or two)!!! Bathroom a little tiny and tired. Forgave all of this for the location and view. Bit pricey but only to be expected...it is Paris after all!!! Wouldn't stay there again as the view was great but not worth nearly £400 a night!
reviews.title: Moonlight and romance!
tipping etiquette
reviews.text: upon having lunch in the hotel restaurant and receiving the check, i saw that there was no indication"service compri" thereon. i inquired to the waitress as in the past the tip was always included in the check. (it is the law in france). she replied that no, the gratuity was not included. i wasn't going to argue the point, so i included the tip noing it would be a duplicate gratuity.on this same visit i experienced the same rip-off. in other places. i wrote to france magazine on the subject and received feed back from others who had the same experience. one couple even demanded a refund and received it. good for them! ed gonzalez
